fusion_models packageïƒ

Fusion models: one py file per model

Submodulesïƒ

fusion_models.base_pl_model moduleïƒ

Base lightning module for all fusion models and parent class for all fusion models.

class fusion_models.base_pl_model.BaseModel(model)[source]ïƒ

Bases: LightningModule

Base model for all fusion models

Fusion model class.

Type:

class

pred_typeïƒ

Type of prediction to be made. Options: binary, multiclass, regression.

Type:

str

Number of classes for multiclass prediction.

Type:

int

Type of fusion to be used. Options: early, late, graph.

Type:

str

kfold_flagïƒ

Whether to use k-fold cross validation.

Type:

bool

Type of modality fusion to be used. Options: operation, subspace, graph, tensor, attention, Uni-modal

Type:

str

Name of the method.

Type:

str

get_model_outputs(x)[source]ïƒ

Get model outputs.

Parameters:

x (tensor) â€“ Input data.

Returns:

  • logits (tensor) â€“ Logits.

  • reconstructions (tensor) â€“

    Reconstructions (returned if the model has a custom loss function such as a subspace

    method)

  • note

  • if you get an error here, check that the forward output is [out,] or [out, reconstructions]

validation_epoch_end(outputs)[source]ïƒ

Gets the final validation epoch outputs and metrics. When metrics are calculated at the validation step and logged on on_epoch=True, the batch metrics are averaged. However, some metrics donâ€™t average well (e.g. R2). Therefore, weâ€™re calculating the final validation metrics here on the full validation set.

Dimensions of image modality. If using 2D images, then the dimensions will be (x, y). If using 3D images, then the dimensions will be (x, y, z).

set_fused_layers(fused_dim)[source]ïƒ

Set layers for fused modality

Parameters:

fused_dim (int) â€“

Dimension of fused modality: how many features are there after fusion?
e.g. if we have 2 modalities with 64 features each, and the fusion method

was concatenation, the fused_dim would be 128

Return type:

None

set_img_layers()[source]ïƒ

Set layers for image modality. If using 2D images, then the layers will use Conv2D layers. If using 3D images, then the layers will use Conv3D layers.

fusion_models.concat_img_latent_tab_doubleloss moduleïƒ

Concat image latent space with tabular data, trained altogether with a custom loss function: MSE + BCE.

fusion_models.concat_img_latent_tab_doubletrain moduleïƒ

Concatenating the latent img space and tabular data. The latent image space is trained separately from both the tabular data and the labels, using the img_latent_subspace_method class.

fusion_models.crossmodal_att moduleïƒ

Crossmodal multi-head attention model. This model uses the self attention and cross modal attention between the two modalities: tabular and image.

class fusion_models.crossmodal_att.CrossmodalMultiheadAttention(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]ïƒ

Bases: ParentFusionModel, Module

Crossmodal multi-head attention model. This model uses the self attention and cross modal attention between the two modalities: tabular and image.

Name of the method.

Type:

str

Type of modality.

str

Dictionary containing the layers of the image data.

Type:

dict

fused_layersïƒ

Sequential layer containing the fused layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

attentionïƒ

Multihead attention layer. Takes in 50 features as input.

Type:

nn.MultiheadAttention

img_denseïƒ

Linear layer. Takes in 50 features as input. This is the output of the multihead attention layer.

Type:

nn.Linear

to50ïƒ

Linear layer. Takes in the number of features of the fused layers as input.

Type:

nn.Linear

ReLU activation function.

Type:

nn.ReLU

List containing the dropout layers for the tabular modality.

Type:

list

final_predictionïƒ

Sequential layer containing the final prediction layers. The final prediction layers take in 200 features.

Type:

nn.Sequential

fusion_models.edge_corr_gnn moduleïƒ

Edge correlation GNN model.

class fusion_models.edge_corr_gnn.EdgeCorrGNN(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]ïƒ

Bases: ParentFusionModel, Module

Graph neural network with the edge weighting as the first tabular modality correlations and the node features as the second tabular modality features.

method_nameïƒ

Name of the method.

Type:

str

modality_typeïƒ

Type of modality.

Type:

str

fusion_typeïƒ

Type of fusion.

Type:

str

graph_makerïƒ

Function that creates the graph data structure.

Type:

function

conv1ïƒ

Graph convolutional layer. The first layer takes in the number of features of the second tabular modality as input.

Type:

GCNConv

conv2ïƒ

Graph convolutional layer. The second layer takes in 64 features as input.

Type:

GCNConv

conv3ïƒ

Graph convolutional layer. The third layer takes in 128 features as input.

Type:

GCNConv

conv4ïƒ

Graph convolutional layer. The fourth layer takes in 256 features as input.

Type:

GCNConv

final_predictionïƒ

Sequential layer containing the final prediction layers. The final prediction layers take in 256 features.

Type:

nn.Sequential

fusion_models.img_tab_channelwise_att moduleïƒ

Image-channel-wise attention fusion model.

class fusion_models.img_tab_channelwise_att.ImageChannelWiseMultiAttention(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]ïƒ

Bases: ParentFusionModel, Module

Channel-wise multiplication net (MRI)

Inspired by the work of Duanmu et al. (2020) [1]., we use channel-wise multiplication to combine tabular data and image data.

method_nameïƒ

Name of the method.

Type:

str

modality_typeïƒ

Type of modality.

Type:

str

fusion_typeïƒ

Type of fusion.

Type:

str

mod1_layersïƒ

Dictionary containing the layers of the 1st type of tabular data.

Type:

dict

img_layersïƒ

Dictionary containing the layers of the image data.

Type:

dict

fused_layersïƒ

Sequential layer containing the fused layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

final_predictionïƒ

Sequential layer containing the final prediction layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

forward(x)[source]ïƒ

Forward pass of the model.

References

Duanmu, H., Huang, P. B., Brahmavar, S., Lin, S., Ren, T., Kong, J., Wang, F., & Duong, T. Q. (2020). Prediction of Pathological Complete Response to Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy in Breast Cancer Using Deep Learning with Integrative Imaging, Molecular and Demographic Data. In A.

  1. Martel, P. Abolmaesumi,

D. Stoyanov, D. Mateus, M. A. Zuluaga, S. K. Zhou, D. Racoceanu, & L. Joskowicz (Eds.), Medical Image Computing and Computer Assisted Intervention â€“ MICCAI 2020 (pp. 242â€“252). Springer International Publishing. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-030-59713-9_24

fusion_models.mcvae_tab moduleïƒ

This module implements the MCVAE (multi-channel variational autoencoder) model for fusing two types of tabular data.

class fusion_models.mcvae_tab.MCVAE_tab(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]ïƒ

Bases: ParentFusionModel, Module

This class implements a model that fuses the two types of tabular data using the MCVAE approach. MCVAE: multi-channel variational autoencoder.

The MCVAE creates a joint latent space of the two types of tabular data based off a joint latent prior and joint decoding.

method_nameïƒ

Name of the method.

Type:

str

modality_typeïƒ

Type of modality.

Type:

str

fusion_typeïƒ

Type of fusion.

Type:

str

subspace_methodïƒ

Class of the subspace method.

Type:

class

mod1_layersïƒ

Dictionary containing the layers of the 1st type of tabular data. Here the first type of tabular data is the joint latent space created

in the mcvae_subspace_method class.

Type:

dict

fused_layersïƒ

Sequential layer containing the fused layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

final_predictionïƒ

Sequential layer containing the final prediction layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

forward(x)[source]ïƒ

Forward pass of the model.

References

Antelmi, L., Ayache, N., Robert, P., & Lorenzi, M. (2019). Sparse Multi-Channel Variational

Autoencoder for the Joint Analysis of Heterogeneous Data. Proceedings of the 36th International Conference on Machine Learning, 302â€“311. https://proceedings.mlr.press/v97/antelmi19a.html

Forward pass of the model.

Parameters:

x (list) â€“ List containing the two types of tabular data.

Returns:

out_pred â€“ List containing the predictions.

Return type:

list

fusion_type = 'subspace'ïƒ
method_name = 'MCVAE Tabular'ïƒ
modality_type = 'both_tab'ïƒ
training: boolïƒ

fusion_models.tab_crossmodal_att moduleïƒ

Crossmodal multi-head attention for tabular data.

class fusion_models.tab_crossmodal_att.TabularCrossmodalMultiheadAttention(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]ïƒ

Bases: ParentFusionModel, Module

This class implements a model that fuses the two types of tabular data using a

cross-modal multi-head attention approach.

Inspired by the work of Golovanevsky et al. (2021) [1]: here we use two types of tabular data as the multi-modal data instead of 3 types in the paper.

method_nameïƒ

Name of the method.

Type:

str

modality_typeïƒ

Type of modality.

Type:

str

fusion_typeïƒ

Type of fusion.

Type:

str

mod1_layersïƒ

Dictionary containing the layers of the 1st type of tabular data.

Type:

dict

mod2_layersïƒ

Dictionary containing the layers of the 2nd type of tabular data.

Type:

dict

fused_layersïƒ

Sequential layer containing the fused layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

final_predictionïƒ

Sequential layer containing the final prediction layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

fused_dimïƒ

Dimension of the fused layer.

Type:

int

attentionïƒ

Multi-head attention layer.

Type:

nn.MultiheadAttention

to50ïƒ

Linear layer to reduce the dimension of the data to 50.

Type:

nn.Linear

reluïƒ

ReLU activation function.

Type:

nn.ReLU

clindropsïƒ

List containing the dropout layers.

Type:

list

forward(x)[source]ïƒ

Forward pass of the model.

References

Golovanevsky, M., Eickhoff, C., & Singh, R. (2022). Multimodal attention-based deep learning for Alzheimerâ€™s disease diagnosis. Journal of the American Medical Informatics Association, 29(12), 2014â€“2022. https://doi.org/10.1093/jamia/ocac168

Accompanying code: (our model is inspired by the work of Golovanevsky et al. (2021) [1]) https://github.com/rsinghlab/MADDi/blob/main/training/train_all_modalities.py

fusion_models.tabular_channelwise_att moduleïƒ

Channel-wise multiplication fusion model for tabular data.

class fusion_models.tabular_channelwise_att.TabularChannelWiseMultiAttention(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]ïƒ

Bases: ParentFusionModel, Module

This class implements a model that fuses the two types of tabular data using a

channel-wise multiplication approach.

Inspired by the work of Duanmu et al. (2020) [1]: here we use two types of tabular data as the multi-modal data instead of image and non-image like in the paper.
